questions.question: How is US federal income tax calculated?
questions.answer: Federal tax uses a progressive bracket system where higher income is taxed at higher rates. Your taxable income is calculated after deductions and credits.

questions.question: Do all states have income tax?
questions.answer: No, 9 states have no state income tax: Texas, Florida, Nevada, Washington, Wyoming, South Dakota, Alaska, Tennessee, and New Hampshire.

questions.question: What's the difference between withholding and estimated taxes?
questions.answer: Withholding is tax taken from your paycheck throughout the year. Estimated taxes are quarterly payments for self-employed individuals or those with additional income.

questions.question: How does the standard deduction work?
questions.answer: The standard deduction reduces your taxable income. For 2024: $14,600 (single), $29,200 (joint), $21,900 (head of household).
